intro: Scabiosa semipapposa var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender garden clover, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring slender stems and small, trifoliate leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and ecologically valuable for pollinators.
